page.title: 02Boynton Village
page.content: Boynton is a small village with only one main street which crosses the B1253 road from York to Bridlington. There are 143 people living in Boynton village. There are about 32 houses including ten bungalows. Each house has quite a big garden at the back or the front. There are 22 detached houses and 10 semi detached houses. The roofs are mainly made of tiles or slates. There are 20 houses made of brick. 2 houses are made of wood and 9 houses are made of chalk. Most houses have a brick garage. There is a mobile shop that comes round Boynton village twice a week. It sells things like tinned foods, crisps, drinks and fruit. A mobile libary comes round on Thursdays. A bread van comes round 3 times a week.The bus service to Bridlington runs 6 days a week with 6 buses a day.
